item.title: ECB Cuts Can’t Solve Europe’s Structural Issues, Schnabel Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Reductions in borrowing costs by the European Central Bank can’t address the structural challenges facing the region’s economy, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel. Speaking at the German Institute for Employment Research, Schnabel said growth is currently only moderat...

item.title: BlackRock Now Wants to Become Private Equity’s Key Financier
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest asset manager, now wants to be a financier for private equity and alternative investment firms. Fresh off a year of almost $30 billion of deals to become a force in managing private credit, financial data and infrastructure assets, Chief Financial O...

item.title: EU Gas Rally Unjustified But May Last Through Winter, BNP Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Supply fears stoking the recent rally in European natural gas prices are unjustified, but the sentiment is so strong that it’s unlikely to ease before the cold season ends, according to BNP Paribas SA. “Prices have gone gangbusters,” Aldo Spanjer, senior commodities strategist at the...

item.title: BlackRock Says It’s Time to Exit UK Bond Bet After Recent Rally
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is ditching an overweight recommendation on UK bonds held since October, anticipating that concern over the country’s fiscal outlook will persist. The world’s largest asset manager has turned neutral on gilts, saying it’s a good time to exit the debt after a recent ral...

item.title: HSBC Hires Ex-BNP Banker Sun as Head of Debt Markets for Asia
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- HSBC Holdings Plc hired former BNP Paribas SA banker George Sun as head of global debt markets for Asia, attracting an outsider even as the bank undergoes a restructuring. A spokeswoman for HSBC confirmed the hire. Sun starts with the bank on March 11 and will be based in Hong Kong. ...

item.title: Chinese Stocks Lure Hedge Funds, Fidelity as Bullish Case Builds
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Chinese stocks are coming back into favor among global investors as the nation’s growing technological heft and expectations for additional stimulus help rekindle optimism. Hedge funds snapped up the most Chinese equities in more than four months last week on a net basis, driven almos...

item.title: Von der Leyen verspricht Milliarden für KI-Entwicklung
item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Sie kündigte bei einem KI-Aktionsgipfel in Paris an, dass die sogenannte InvestAI-Initiative um 50 Milliarden Euro aufgestockt werde.
